TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: When you answer a question on a test with "More boosters".
When you see Jeb when you close your eyes. He scares me...

Yup. Lego Star Wars cups with Hello Kitty combined? That's awful, XD

Actually, the picture was of the asparagus staged cupcakes,
When you're studying solubility constants in chemistry, see "Ksp" on a test, and end up getting immediately distracted by thoughts of Bob, Jeb, and Bill.
When you wake up in bed with a jolt immediately after crashing on the Mun whilst trying to land.
When you here the VAB music in your head constantly to the point of insanity.

when you right click on screenshots to rotate the camera.

i have done this so many times omg
When you refer to parallel parking as docking; eg "This spot is pretty small. I don't know if we'll have room to dock".

When you look at a model of a WWI zeppelin and say "That uses too many struts. And it would lag really bad."

"That uses too many struts. And it would lag really bad."

And it would lag really bad.

would lag really bad

lag

I'm guilty of this

When you right click on screenshots to rotate the camera.

When you start thinking if you can find a mod to actually allow you to do this.

When you spend all day on the KSP Forums while you are meant to be working, preparing for your "work" on KSP.

When you refer to parallel parking as docking; eg "This spot is pretty small. I don't know if we'll have room to dock".

Worse, far worse if you has to remind yourself that the Oberth effect don't work on turnabouts.
When you start building your craft out of LEGOs.
When there's a thread on the KSPF dedicated to it. ohwait.

When you right click on screenshots to rotate the camera.

I totally do this all the time,
When every other facebook status is KSP related, its surprising how few people care that I landed my first rover on the Mun, such empty lives they have

When every other facebook status is KSP related, its surprising how few people care that I landed my first rover on the Mun, such empty lives they have

My grandmother liked my mun landing screenshot. Nobody else cared.
I spend hours Live streaming KSP so yea, it has really affected my routine.

My grandmother liked my mun landing screenshot. Nobody else cared.

My last two cover photos have been KSP-related. One reentry shot and one station. Only one like...
I don't know if this has been posted yet, but I find myself trying to right-click and pan around screenshots of KSP stuff that I find
We were doing contour levels at uni, and working on how kerbs (as in, the thing on the side of roads) are done, and I kept thinking of the little green guys.
I've actually noticed that KSP makes us lose our minds when anyone or anything displays a lack of knowledge about orbital mechanics. For me, it's REALLY bad. like, fist clenching bad.
Read all the above. That's how.
I know I play too much KSP because the only things I do when I don't play is watching KSP videos and going around the forum. I was very bad when the forum was down :-/

When you are building with legos or watching someone build with legos and think: he's gonna need some struts on that.

When you see an 18-wheeler and think that it's thrust to wheight ration is far too low.
When you wonder why the space agencies haven't started use mods yet.
